value: Deflector Shield protects your Armor from taking damage.\nDeflector Shield recharges after {0} of not taking damage. Nuclear Damage inherently bypasses Deflector Shield.
Velocity determines your ship's maximum movement speed.
Acceleration determines how fast your ship gains speed.
Pickup Range defines the distance at which Power-Ups are attracted to your ship.

Destroying enemies has a small chance to drop a Power-Up. Collecting a Power-Up grants a temporary buff.\n\nWhen an enemy is destroyed, the highest Power-Up chance among all allies is used to determine whether a Power-Up drops.
Dash is consumed when you use your Engine.
闪跃充能速度提高|每秒充能
Your ship constantly recharges Dash. The base recharge rate is {0} per second.
Engines are items that trigger when you Dash. Some Engines can damage enemies.
Melee weapons are engaging enemies in close-combat.
Projectiles are fired by ranged weapons. Projectiles can pierce, chain or split towards other enemies.
Certain items enable you to reflect a portion of incoming damage back to your attackers.
Enemies whose Armor falls below Death Threshold after taking damage are instantly destroyed.
Increases the blast radius of weapons that deal damage in an area, allowing them to hit more enemies or cover a larger zone.
Enhances the damage dealt by weapons that affect an area.
{0}Kinetic{1} hits can cause {2}Debris{3}. Debris deals {4} AoE damage in {5} radius. Debris Damage cannot trigger Debris.
{0}Explosive{1} Damage from hits can cause {2}Aftershock{3}. Each Aftershock deals {4} damage of the previous hit. Aftershock can repeat up to {5} times.
{0}Electric{1} Damage from hits can cause {2}Shock{3}. A Shock lasts {4}. Each Shock applies {5} to all Resistances. Shock can stack up to {6} times.
All {0}Plasma{1} Damage can {2}blind{3} enemies. Blinded enemies have {4} less damage and velocity over {5}. The effect of Blind is reduced together with its duration.
{0}Nuclear{1} Damage from hits can cause {2}Radiation{3}. Radiation deals {4} of the initial hit over {5}. Each instance of Radiation stacks.
{0}Explosive{1} Damage adds to a stacking pool of {2}Burn{3} that deals damage over time and decays by {4} each tick.

Multicrit lets you roll for extra critical strikes, adding their damage until a roll fails or the Multicrit amount is reached. Each successive critical strike in a Multicrit chain has {0} of the previous critical strike chance.
Multiluck grants additional attempts on Luck based rolls, selecting the best outcome.

Luck influences the probability of chance-based triggers. Beneficial triggers are increased, while harmful ones are reduced. However, Luck usually cannot raise trigger chances above {0}.\nLuck has no effect on Damage, Dodge, Item or Power-Up drops.
Damage over Time (DoT) applies continuous damage to a target.
Enemies that have at least one Virus applied to them.
A Virus hacks enemies and weakens their system. By default, there is a maximum of 1 Virus per enemy.
Fields apply a Buff to you and nearby allies.
Each Venom Boost grants {0} increased Damage over Time.
Each Turbo Boost grants {0} increased Attack Speed.
Each Shield Boost grants {0} less Damage Taken.
Each Focus Boost grants {0} increased Critical Strike Chance.
Each Forge Boost grants {0} increased Armor Repair.
The total damage per second (dps) your ship is dealing to a single target, using all of its weapons.
The average maximum hit you can survive.
Your ship is destroyed when Armor reaches zero.
Chips are items that can drop in all rarities. Their affixes apply to your ship when placed into an allocated Chip Socket.
Drones are lightweight Minions that can be spawned by your ship.
Bulwarks are heavy Minions that can be spawned by your ship.
Minions are allies that can be spawned by your ship. Minion Power determines what percentage of your ship's offensive stats are applied to your minions.
Mines are deployed by weapons and detonate on enemy contact.
Parasites latch onto enemies, turning your weapons against them.
The higher your Dodge, the greater your chance to avoid damage entirely, up to a maximum of {0} out of 100 hits.
Avoid damage {0} out of {1} times.\nDodge cannot be higher than {2}.
Pushes enemies back on impact. Repeated knockbacks become less effective as enemies build resistance, which fades over time.
Projectiles that chain on hit seek a nearby enemy as their next target.
Projectiles that split on hit create new projectiles that seek nearby enemies as their next target.
After {0}, each second a boss takes damage, it gains 1 Exhaustion Stack.\nEach Stack causes {1} more Damage taken. Maximum Stacks are {2}.
Forged in a past cycle, this item no longer exists in current timelines.\n\nUse {0} to upgrade it to the present.
Increased / reduced are additive modifiers.\n\nFor example, two modifiers of {0}20%{1} increased damage and {2}30%{3} increased damage result in a total of {4}+50%{5} damage.
More / less are multiplicative modifiers.\n\nFor example, {0}50%{1} increased damage followed by {2}20%{3} more damage results in a total of 1.5 × 1.2 = 1.8, or {4}+80%{5} total damage.
